item.title: G-MODE Archives+ Stella Deus: Time of Alchemy announced for Switch, PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Switch

Due out in Japan on November 20 for Switch, December 4 for PC.

G-MODE will release ATLUS-developed RPG Stella Deus: Time of Alchemy as a G-MODE Archives+ title for Switch via Nintendo eShop on November 20 and PC via Steam on December 4 in Japan, the company announced. The PC version will be available worldwide, but only supports Japanese.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

The world is burdened with a destiny of destruction.

Cherished friends, precious memories—this is our story.

Key Features

  • Tactical battles using an Action Point (AP) system.
  • Effective Zone (EZ) system enables powerful team attacks when allies and enemies are within range.
  • Unique skills and combo attacks for each character.
  • Character strengthening with Class Change.
  • Craft powerful gear through item synthesis.
  • 50 stages of strategic gameplay.
  • An original scenario set in the Stella Deus world.

Series Overview

This title is the mobile app version of the tactical role-playing game Stella Deus, originally released in 2004 for the PlayStation 2.

It was initially adapted for Japanese flip phones (mobile phones with limited functionality, popular before the rise of smartphones).

Set after the events of Raven Spirits, this game features an all-new, original scenario.

Don’t worry if you’re new to the series—it’s a fully standalone story anyone can enjoy.

With a hardcore difficulty designed to test even veteran players, embark on a new adventure across 50 challenging stages.

Story

A white mist called Miasma—it reduces all it touches to nothing.

A continent engulfed in its sea, a world burdened with the fate of inevitable ruin.

A religion that embraces the end…

Spirits that are bound to the laws of the world…

And alchemy, born from harnessing their power.

The protagonists continue their journey, seeking a way to heal a dying world.

Game System

The game alternates between story and battle phases, advancing the narrative while testing your tactical skills.

In battle, you’ll use an AP (Action Point) system to choose your actions strategically.

Make full use of each character’s unique skill commands and powerful team-based combo attacks to take down formidable enemies!

Customize your strategy by mastering the Class Change system and item synthesis, allowing for personalized character growth.

Use every advantage at your disposal to conquer all stages!

item.title: Cho Aniki Collection for PC now available
item.content:encoded:
The PC version of Cho Aniki Collection is now available via Steam, developer Edia announced. It is priced at a 10 percent-off launch discount price of $44.99 until December 2, after which it will cost $49.99.

Cho Aniki Collection, which includes Cho Aniki and Ai Cho Aniki, first launched for Switch on December 12, 2024 in Japan, followed by January 29, 2025 worldwide.

Here is an overview of the collection, via its Steam page:

About

The first game in the legendary Cho Aniki series of shooting games created by Masaya, Cho Aniki (PC Engine), and the second game in the series, Ai Cho Aniki (PC Engine), have been fully ported for the Steam.

The ports of these classics boast a number of additional features, such as Sound Mode, Visual Mode, and Rewind.

These titles are an absolute must for retro game and shooting game fans alike.

Cho Aniki (released December 25, 1992)

The Emperor of Planet Builder, who has won the Galactic Bodybuilding Contest for 10 consecutive years, is worried that his planet’s protein is running low.

The Emperor, believing that “muscle is the greatest of virtues,” has begun indiscriminately invading neighboring planets and building protein mining plants on them.

Sensing an impending crisis, Idaten and Benten of the Heavenly World set out on a mission to achieve peace by destroying the Builder Army…

Ai Cho Aniki (released February 24, 1995)

Two years have passed since Idaten and Benten last fought.

After the death of Emperor Roid, peace was restored to the galaxy, and people returned to lives of peace…

Meanwhile, Idaten sensed disturbances again in the Builder Star System and went alone to investigate.

His last known location was on Planet Builder! Upon hearing this, Benten dispatched two heroes, Adon and Samson, to search for Idaten and investigate the strange happenings on Planet Builder.

item.title: Dragon’s Dogma II sales top four million
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

100,000 units sold since September 30.

Total sales for Dragon’s Dogma II have surpassed four million units as of November 5, Capcom announced.

Dragon’s Dogma II launched for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam on March 22, 2024.

Total sales for the game were last reported to have surpassed 3.9 million units as of September 30.
